definition: to sweep clean/to clean out
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
broom
to sweep
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time

sentences.english: If I have a wad of cash, I find myself going through it quickly.
sentences.chinese: 若我手裏現在一卷現金，我會將它一掃而空。

sentences.english: Then electric fields generated by the solar wind sweep away the charged particles.
sentences.chinese: 然後，太陽風產生的電場將帶電粒子一掃而空。

sentences.english: Or as a dandelion see-pod and be swept away.
sentences.chinese: 或者像結莢的蒲公英被一掃而空。

sentences.english: your problems are completely taken away because  you're part of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 你的問題都會一掃而空，因爲你成爲了人羣的一部分。

sentences.english: One's work is swept away when one becomes identified.
sentences.chinese: 一個人變得認同時，他的工作便一掃而空。

sentences.english: Your new boss has swept away the old code by breaking it himself.
sentences.chinese: 而你的新老闆親自將過去的規範一掃而空。

sentences.english: If Merrill fell, confidence would drain away.
sentences.chinese: 如果美林陷落，信心將一掃而空。

elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered

a common occurrence (idiom)

tied up in a bundle on a high shelf/to put sth on the back burner/no longer a high priority
(idiom) fully displaying one's capabilities
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
